_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Firstly, a person, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption
As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, they enter and remain in the second absorption
they enter and remain in the third absorption
they enter and remain in the fourth absorption
The contemplation of phenomena [an4.124:: They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as impermanent
They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as suffering
They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as diseased
They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as a boil
They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as a dart
They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as misery
They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as an affliction
They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as alien
They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as falling apart
They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as empty
They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as not-self.
